channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Australians download COVIDSafe app more than 2 million times, social distancing in NSW partially relaxed, nation's death toll stands at 84

item.description: In 1965, the Australian Government committed 1000 front-line troops to the war in Vietnam after a request for military assistance from the South Vietnamese Government.
item.title: From the Archives, 1965: Australia commits front-line troops to Vietnam

item.description: The 840 AFL players will be invited to hook up via a nationwide teleconference on Tuesday before submitting their thoughts on key issues via an email survey.
item.title: AFL players to thrash out footy restart issues

item.description: The former first lady's memoir has sold more than 10 million copies.
item.title: Michelle Obama's Becoming documentary to hit Netflix

item.dc:creator: Danielle Cronin
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should contact (not visit) your GP, local hospital or 13HEALTH.
item.title: Coronavirus LIVE Queensland updates: about 100,000 COVID-19 tests performed as state warned not to cause a second wave of infections

item.dc:creator: Fran Rimrod
item.description: A Perth clinical research company has been selected to undertake a human trial of a vaccine to combat COVID-19.
item.title: WA coronavirus LIVE: Perth research company seeks West Australians for COVID-19 vaccine trial

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: The three-week-old baby girl remains in hospital, more than a month after the incident came to the attention of police.
item.title: Baby left with 'life-threatening injuries' after Sunshine Coast assault

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: Premier Gladys Berejiklian says the timeline for the return to full-time schooling will be revised after a fortnight of having students in school on a rostered basis.
item.title: NSW wants children back at school full time before end of term 2

item.dc:creator: Marissa Calligeros
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus LIVE updates: Victorian schools could reopen this term; Australians download COVIDSafe app more than 2 million times; nation's death toll rises to 84

item.description: Vaccine optimism from UK as more than 2 million Australians download COVIDSafe app.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.description: Some of his best work
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Andrew Dyson

item.description: The latest work by Sydney Morning Herald editorial cartoonist Cathy Wilcox.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Cathy Wilcox

item.dc:creator: Lucy Battersby
item.description: The S&P/ASX 200 is flat this morning, a falls in NAB, gold miners and CSL counter-balance gains in Transurban, Westpac, and Aristocrat Leisure.
item.title: ASX flat, Westpac reveals $2.2bn impairment charge

item.description: Andrew Weldon has been a contributor to The Age and The Sunday Age for many years. His cartoons have been published widely nationally and internationally, including in The New Yorker, The Spectator and Private Eye. He has published two book collections of his work and several childrens' books. He smells funny.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Andrew Weldon

item.description: Mark Evans says the elite training, playing and broadcast facilities on the Gold Coast and in Brisbane help make Queensland an ideal host of an AFL quarantine hub.
item.title: Queensland has compelling case to be AFL hub: Suns CEO

item.description: Illustrations by the artist from The Age.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Matt Golding

item.description: Senior football figures Chris Scott and Neil Balme have cautioned against dramatic cuts to the AFL in the wake of the coronavirus-enforced shutdown of the competition.
item.title: Scott, Balme urge against further AFL cuts

item.description: "We may have to think in terms of some different ways to put money in people's pockets," said the House Speaker.
item.title: Nancy Pelosi says 'guaranteed income' plan for Americans worth considering

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, April 28, 2020

item.dc:creator: Dominic Powell
item.description: Retailing conglomerate Wesfarmers will fast track a review of struggling department store Target, opening the door for a possible sale or restructure.
item.title: Wesfarmers flags Target restructure as sales smashed through April

item.description: Former Adelaide plumber Matt Leo has fulfilled his dream of making it to the NFL with the Philadelphia Eagles taking him as part of the league's international pathway program.
item.title: From plumbing in Adelaide to a spot on an NFL list

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: NSW social distancing restrictions will be relaxed from Friday, with two adults allowed to make a visit to someone in a home.
item.title: Berejiklian announces first relaxation of NSW social distancing rules

item.description: Bondi beach reopens
item.title: Bondi beach reopens on Tuesday, April 28, 2020

item.dc:creator: Kate Hedley
item.description: WA's opposition leader Liza Harvey was "one person who will not be listened to", Mr Wyatt said, after Ms Harvey claimed the government was "hoarding a war chest of cash".
item.title: WA Treasurer rubbishes opposition claims McGowan is 'hoarding a war chest'

item.description: The Victorian government is unlikely to use taxpayer money to fund any Melbourne-based quarantine hub to ensure the AFL season restarts.
item.title: Pakula expects AFL to bear cost of a Melbourne quarantine hub

item.dc:creator: Emma Young
item.description: While plenty of homebuyers have been checking out the offerings online, this hasn't translated into bookings for private viewings, says a Fremantle agent.
item.title: Relieved Perth real estate agents plan home opens for this weekend

item.description: In New Plymouth, the local McDonalds store had customers waiting in line at the drive-through from 3.30am, with 40 cars in a row, snaking outside the location.
item.title: With coronavirus restrictions eased, Kiwis flock to Maccas

item.description: The NRL will meet clubs and the RLPA on Tuesday afternoon to finalise guidelines to allow players to resume training next week.
item.title: Can we do school drop-offs? NRL, players to finalise biosecurity rules

item.description: The web address "ReOpen Mississippi" belongs to a PR agency based just outside Washington which has several former employees working in the Trump administration.
item.title: Right-wing groups behind the US anti-lockdown protests

item.description: The Australian sharemarket is expected to open slightly higher on Tuesday, as oil prices again fell sharply in overnight trading.
item.title: 8@eight: ASX set for modest rise despite tumbling oil prices

item.description: If effective, the first few million doses of their vaccine could be available by September — months ahead of any of the other announced efforts.
item.title: In race for a coronavirus vaccine, an Oxford group makes strides

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: Jackie Trad won South Brisbane with just 500 more first preference votes than Amy MacMahon and retained the seat on the back of LNP preferences.
item.title: Amy MacMahon set to take on Jackie Trad again in South Brisbane

item.description: Ronaldinho and his brother were held in jail for 32 days before being released on $1.6 million bail.
item.title: 'I never imagined I would go through something like this': Ronaldinho breaks silence

item.description: Testing for COVID-19 at the NSW Health Pathology at the Prince of Wales Hospital and Virology Laboratory.
item.title: Testing Times - NSW Health Pathology at the Prince of Wales Hospital

item.description: The clause under which Umar Akmal was found guilty relates to a failure to inform authorities about approaches to engage in corrupt practices, including match-fixing or spot-fixing.
item.title: 'A timely reminder': Pakistan batsman banned for three years

item.description: The children were on an educational cruise of the Caribbean when the pandemic forced them to radically change their plans for returning home in March.
item.title: Dutch students complete Atlantic crossing forced by virus

item.description: The trial will involve groups of healthcare workers and patients wearing nicotine patches and other groups wearing placebo patches.
item.title: French scientists to test theory that nicotine combats COVID-19

item.dc:creator: Bevan Shields
item.description: Health officials worry a coronavirus-related syndrome or some other unidentified infectious pathogen is emerging in children in the UK.
item.title: 'Very worried': Britain issues alert as possible new coronavirus syndrome emerges in children

item.description: The WikiLeaks founder's US extradition case will be delayed over concerns about his ability to attend hearings in person amid the UK's coronavirus lockdown.
item.title: Assange's case may be delayed until November amid coronavirus lockdown

item.description: Streets will be closed to vehicle traffic and temporary bike lanes created to offer New Yorkers more space to stay apart outside during the lockdown.
item.title: New York City aims to open 160km of streets to pedestrians during pandemic

item.description: The study, published in the journal Nature Research, buttresses the notion that the virus can spread through tiny airborne particles known as aerosols.
item.title: Coronavirus lingers in air of crowded spaces, new study finds

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: Researchers have discovered 33 more regions of the genome that raises the risk of getting melanoma, giving greater insight into the causes of the deadly cancer.
item.title: Research doubles understanding of what causes melanoma

item.dc:creator: Max Koslowski
item.description: The Q+A episode featured some of the tensest sparring yet over the reopening of schools during the coronavirus pandemic.
item.title: Fears Australia’s 'clever country' label could be lost for generations

item.dc:creator: Melissa Cunningham
item.description: Infectious disease experts say it is safe to reopen schools as Chief Health Officer Brett Sutton appeared to soften his stance against keeping them closed until the end of term two.
item.title: 'Evidence says it is safe to reopen schools'

item.description: Trivia buffs: test your knowledge with today's interactive superquiz and target.
item.title: Target and superquiz, Tuesday, April 28

item.dc:creator: Nick O'Malley
item.description: The government's plans to spur the post-coronavirus economy with gas-fired power has been challenged as uneconomical and environmentally destructive.
item.title: Government's gas-led economic recovery plans questioned

item.description: Follow our rolling coverage.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.dc:creator: Harriet Veitch
item.description: Yes, I know it looks a bit silly. I certainly feel silly, as well as rather like a bank robber.
item.title: I'm wearing a mask for you

item.dc:creator: Rachel Clun
item.description: Researchers from universities around the country are collecting data about the most critically ill coronavirus patients in a bid to improve their treatment.
item.title: Without a vaccine, experts turn to data to help treat COVID-19 patients

item.dc:creator: Nick Miller
item.description: Can you fall in love with contemporary art over the internet? A new initiative hopes you can - and that collectors will open their wallets.
item.title: Free 'virtual viewing rooms' in redrawn Melbourne Art Fair
